newsitem.title: ESTONIA: CRESCO EYE MORE LATVIA, LITHUANIA BUSINESS.
newsitem.headline: CRESCO EYE MORE LATVIA, LITHUANIA BUSINESS.

text.p: Estonian investment house Baltic Cresco plans to be more agressive in Latvia and has several concrete projects coming up in August, Andres Ratsepp, Baltic Cresco chief executive, said on Friday.
"Right now we are active on the secondary market in Latvia, but we want to be more agressive on the placement side and not only on the secondary market," Ratsepp told Reuters in an interview.
"We look to be active on the primary market," he added.
The investment company's plans include some financing projects in Latvia and some active promotion of its services.
"We have a corporate financing project coming up in Latvia in August and we will be holding several presentations in Riga in late April," he added.
Ratsepp remained positive on the Latvian market but said there was a problem with liqudity.
"The Latvian market is very interesting as the stocks are cheaper and there can be a good increase in prices," he said.
"However, the problem is that the infrastructure of the stock exchange causes the liquidity to suffer," he added.
Ratsepp also said Cresco was also actively watching Lithuania.
"The Lithuanian market is large and more attractive and we are working there," he said.
Ratsepp said that his firm was working on any privisation projects in Latvia and Lithuania at present but was monitoring developments.
